item.title: Ember Hot Seat Episode 002
item.description:
Hey Ember Hot Seat listeners! We’re back this week with Kasper Tidemann, CTO and cofounder of Meemo, in the Hot Seat. He’s going to give his perspective on getting started with Ember, his journey in choosing Ember, and how he’s overcome some of the difficulties. We also touch on why it’s important to give back to the community and why Ember was the framework of choice for his company. Kasper made mention of his blog and to a video he would record of his own JS framework meeho.js. I hope you enjoy!

This week we’ve recorded it in stereo AAAAAAND even have some theme music provided by a good friend of mine Mitchell Wilcox haha. The production quality keeps going up with each week. I’m still waiting on iTunes podcast approval, but if you’d like to subscribe to the RSS feed, you can do it here: http://emberhotseat.com/feed/index.xml.

If you’d like to be in the Hot Seat or have feedback on the show, please reach out to us on Twitter @emberhotseat. We look forward to hearing from you.

-DeVaris

item.title: Ember Hot Seat Episode 001: Tom Dale
item.description:
Welcome to the Ember Hot Seat, your bi-weekly web series dedicated to all things Ember.js. In this week’s episode, we speak with Tom Dale, Ember.js core team member and Tilde.io co-founder, about the best way to get started with Ember, upcoming changes in Ember Data, Polymer, Tom’s fashion tips, and of course the wonderful Troll Comment of the Week.

Sign up on the home page for updates and follow us on Twitter at @emberhotseat.
